TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SubMenuStyle extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style implements class System.ComponentModel.ICustomTypeDescriptor
Public Class SubMenuStyle Inherits Style Implements ICustomTypeDescriptor
type SubMenuStyle = class inherit Style interface ICustomTypeDescriptor

Docs.summary: Represents the style of a submenu in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> class to represent the style of a submenu in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control. A submenu can be displayed within either a static menu or a dynamic menu. A static menu is always visible on a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control, whereas a dynamic menu is displayed only when the user positions the mouse pointer over a parent menu item that contains a dynamic submenu. You can specify different style characteristics (such as font size and color) for the submenus within a static menu and a dynamic menu by using the properties in the following table.
|Submenu item style property|Description| |---------------------------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.DynamicMenuStyle%2A>|The style settings for a submenu within a dynamic menu.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.StaticMenuStyle%2A>|The style settings for a submenu within a static menu.|
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> class inherits most of its members from the `Style` class. It extends the `Style` class by providing properties that control the amount of space around a menu item's text. Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle.HorizontalPadding%2A> property to control the amount of space to the left and right of the menu item's text. Similarly, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle.VerticalPadding%2A> property controls the amount of space above and below the menu item's text.
For more information on the inherited style settings, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style>.
> [!NOTE] > Set the `z-index` of HTML objects that are associated with a submenu by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style.CssClass%2A> property of the submenu style. The `z-index` attribute defines the stacking order of rendered HTML objects. By default, dynamic menu items will appear above any HTML object that has the default z-index (0).
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to specify a custom style for a submenu within a dynamic menu.
[!code-aspx-csharp[MenuDynamicMenuStyle#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MenuDynamicMenuStyle/CS/menudynamicmenustylecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[MenuDynamicMenuStyle#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MenuDynamicMenuStyle/VB/menudynamicmenustylevb.aspx#1)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this constructor to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> class. This constructor is commonly used when dynamically populating the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.LevelSubMenuStyles%2A> collection. It is also used when extending the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> class to initialize the submenu item style properties, such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.DynamicMenuStyle%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.StaticMenuStyle%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void CopyFrom(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style s) cil managed
Public Overrides Sub CopyFrom (s As Style)

Docs.summary: Copies the style properties of the specified object into the current instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle.CopyFrom%2A> method to duplicate the style properties of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> object that calls this method.
> [!CAUTION] > All properties in the current instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> class will be replaced by the corresponding properties in the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object.
To copy style properties without replacing any set values, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle.MergeWith%2A> method.

The -implemented object that contains the context information for the current location (URL).
Docs.summary: Adds the style properties of the object to the specified object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle.FillStyleAttributes%2A> method to add the style properties of the current instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> class to the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.CssStyleCollection?displayProperty=nameWithType> object.
> [!NOTE] > This method is used only by control developers.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Web::UI::WebControls::Unit HorizontalPadding { System::Web::UI::WebControls::Unit get(); void set(System::Web::UI::WebControls::Unit value); };
member this.HorizontalPadding : System.Web.UI.WebControls.Unit with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the amount of space to the left and right of a submenu.
Docs.value: The amount of space to the left and right of the text of a submenu. The default is 0.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle.HorizontalPadding%2A> property to control the amount of space between the text of the submenu item and the side of the containing menu. To control the vertical space between submenu items, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle.VerticalPadding%2A> property.

Docs.exception: The selected value is of or is less than 0.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void MergeWith(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style s) cil managed
Public Overrides Sub MergeWith (s As Style)

Docs.param: The object to combine settings with.
Docs.summary: Combines the style properties of the specified object with those of the current instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle.MergeWith%2A> method to combine the style properties of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object with the style properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> object that this method is called from.
> [!CAUTION] > This method joins the style properties by setting each property that is not set in the current <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> object with its corresponding value in the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object. Only properties that have not been set will be updated. If a property in the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object is not set, the corresponding property in the current <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle> object does not change.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the amount of space above and below a submenu.
Docs.value: The amount of space above and below a submenu. The default is 0.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle.VerticalPadding%2A> property to control the amount of vertical space between the text of submenu items. To control the horizontal space around submenu text, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SubMenuStyle.HorizontalPadding%2A> property.

Docs.exception: The selected value is of or is less than 0.
